snippet: The head of the United Nations panel investigating possible war crimes in the Gaza conflict last summer resigned after what he said were Israeli accusations of personal bias.
abstract: William Schabas, chairman of United Nations panel investigating alleged war crimes in 2014 Gaza conflict, resigns from panel, citing accusations by Israel of personal bias.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The head of the United Nations panel investigating possible war crimes in the Gaza conflict last summer resigned after what he said were Israeli accusations of personal bias.

headline.main: Leader of War Crimes Inquiry Into 2014 Gaza Conflict Resigns
headline.print_headline: Leader of War Crimes Inquiry Into ’14 Gaza Conflict Resigns

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
